block.p: Lindsay Howe Amon and Matthew David Specktor were married yesterday at the house of the bride's mother in Little Compton, R.I. The Rev. Richard DenUyl Jr., a Congregational minister, officiated.

The bride, 28, is a freelance magazine writer. She graduated from Dartmouth College. She is a daughter of Deborah Anderson Ingram of Little Compton and Greenwich, Conn., and of Carl Henry Amon III of New York. Mr. Amon is a partner in White & Case, the New York law firm. The bride is a stepdaughter of Karen Kolodny and of D. John Ingram.

She is a daughter of Deborah Anderson Ingram of Little Compton and Greenwich, Conn., and of Carl Henry Amon III of New York. Mr. Amon is a partner in White & Case, the New York law firm. The bride is a stepdaughter of Karen Kolodny and of D. John Ingram.

The bridegroom, 33, is the director of business development for the Los Angeles office of Rightscenter.com, an Internet site for exchanging intellectual properties. He is also a writer. He graduated from Hampshire College. He is the son of Katherine McGaffey Howe of Edgewood, Wash., and Frederick A. Specktor of Santa Monica, Calif. The bridegroom's mother retired as a screenwriter, and his father is an agent at the Creative Artists Agency in Los Angeles.
